select t.type_code as type_code, bat.type_name as type_name, bat.parent_type_code as type_parent_code, t.type_level as type_level, t.type_count as type_count FROM( select type1 as type_code, 1 as type_level, count(*) as type_count from t_case_report where org_path like CONCAT(#{orgPath,jdbcType=VARCHAR},'%') and clevel in
#{item} AND ymd >=#{beginYMD,jdbcType=INTEGER} and ymd <=#{endYMD,jdbcType=INTEGER} and chour in
#{item}
group by type1 UNION select type2 as type_code, 2 as type_level, count(*) as type_count from t_case_report where org_path like CONCAT(#{orgPath,jdbcType=VARCHAR},'%') and clevel in
#{item} AND ymd >=#{beginYMD,jdbcType=INTEGER} and ymd <=#{endYMD,jdbcType=INTEGER} and chour in
#{item}
group by type2 )as t left join b_alarm_type as bat on t.type_code=bat.TYPE_CODE where t.type_code is not NULL

cyear as years , cmonth as months, cday as days, count(*) as period_count from t_case_report where org_path like CONCAT(#{orgPath,jdbcType=VARCHAR},'%') and clevel in

select chour as chour, count(*) as period_count from t_case_report where ymd >=#{beginYMD,jdbcType=INTEGER} and ymd <=#{endYMD,jdbcType=INTEGER} and org_path like CONCAT(#{orgPath,jdbcType=VARCHAR},'%') and clevel in
#{item} AND type2 in
#{item} AND chour in

group by chour

select t.org_id as org_id, org.code as org_code, org.path as org_path, org.parent_id as org_parentid, left(org.path, (LENGTH(org.PATH)-LENGTH(org.CODE)-1)) as org_parentpath, org.short_name as org_name, t.type_code as type_code, bat.type_name as type_name, bat.parent_type_code as type_parent_code, t.type_level as type_level, ifnull(org_type_count,0) as org_type_count from t_organ as org left join ( select org_id as org_id, type1 as type_code, 1 as type_level, count(*) as org_type_count from t_case_report where ymd >=#{beginYMD,jdbcType=INTEGER} and ymd <=#{endYMD,jdbcType=INTEGER} and org_path like CONCAT(#{orgPath,jdbcType=VARCHAR},'%') and clevel in
#{item} AND type1 in
#{item} AND chour in
#{item}
group by org_id, type1 UNION select org_id as org_id, type2 as type_code, 2 as type_level, count(*) as org_type_count from t_case_report where ymd >=#{beginYMD,jdbcType=INTEGER} and ymd <=#{endYMD,jdbcType=INTEGER} and org_path like CONCAT(#{orgPath,jdbcType=VARCHAR},'%') and clevel in
#{item} AND type2 in
#{item} AND chour in
#{item}
group by org_id, type2 )as t on org.organ_id=t.org_id left join b_alarm_type as bat on t.type_code=bat.TYPE_CODE where org.path like CONCAT(#{orgPath,jdbcType=VARCHAR},'%')

SELECT org.ORGAN_ID as org_id, org.name as org_name, IFNULL(t.amount,0) as amount FROM t_organ AS org LEFT JOIN ( SELECT
ole.level2_id as org_id,
ole.level3_id as org_id,
ole.level4_id as org_id,
ole.level5_id as org_id,
ole.level6_id as org_id,
ole.level7_id as org_id,
ifnull(count(*) ,0) AS amount FROM t_case_report AS cp LEFT JOIN t_organ_level AS ole ON cp.org_id = ole.organ_id WHERE
ole.level1_id = #{orgId,jdbcType=INTEGER} and
ole.level2_id = #{orgId,jdbcType=INTEGER} and
ole.level3_id = #{orgId,jdbcType=INTEGER} and
ole.level4_id = #{orgId,jdbcType=INTEGER} and
ole.level5_id = #{orgId,jdbcType=INTEGER} and
ole.level6_id = #{orgId,jdbcType=INTEGER} and
ymd >=#{beginYmd,jdbcType=INTEGER} and ymd <=#{endYmd,jdbcType=INTEGER}
and cp.clevel in
#{item}
and cp.type2 in
#{item}
GROUP BY
ole.level2_id
ole.level3_id
ole.level4_id
ole.level5_id
ole.level6_id
ole.level7_id
) AS t ON t.org_id = org.organ_id where org.PARENT_ID= #{orgId,jdbcType=INTEGER}
